texts: Due to track replacement work on the Northern line no trains will run between East Finchley and High Barnet/Mill Hill East on Saturdays and Sundays, 10-11 and 17-18 December 2005.
Valid Underground tickets will be accepted on local bus services

Transport for London (TfL) is investing £10 billion over the next 
five years to improve and expand London's transport network, with more than half 
of that going into the Tube.

The track improvement works are being carried out by Tube Lines, who are 
responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Northern line.
Two Rail Replacement Bus Services will be running on these weekends:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Service A - Every 5-10 minutes between East Finchley and High Barnet, 
calling at all stations. For Totteridge and Whetstone Station the bus will call 
at Whetstone High Road","Service B - East Finchley - Finchley Central - Mill Hill East every 15 
minutes"]}
Valid Underground tickets will be accepted on local bus services.
Passengers should allow an extra 30 minutes for their journeys particularly late at night in order to make their connections with last trains.

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Transport for London (TfL) is investing £10 billion over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, more than half of that in the Tube","Tube Lines are responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Jubilee, Northern and Piccadilly lines."]}
